meanings.definition: To deceive or swindle by means of a gold brick.
meanings.sent1: The con artist goldbricked the unsuspecting victim by selling a fake gold brick.
meanings.sent2: She goldbricked her way into the wealthy businessman's trust with promises of rare gold bricks.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky thief goldbricked the tourists by offering them a 'discounted' gold brick.
meanings.sent4: His smooth talk and fake smiles goldbricked many into believing his gold brick was real.
meanings.sent5: The scammer's plan to goldbrick the old lady with a painted gold brick was quickly uncovered.

meanings.definition: To avoid work or responsibility by pretending to be busy or working.
meanings.sent1: He goldbricked his way through the day by looking busy but doing nothing.
meanings.sent2: The lazy student goldbricked his homework by pretending to research all day.
meanings.sent3: She tried to goldbrick her chores by rearranging the same papers over and over.
meanings.sent4: The employee goldbricked his tasks by constantly shuffling papers without actually working.
meanings.sent5: The manager noticed the employee trying to goldbrick his responsibilities and warned him sternly.

meanings.definition: A person who deceives or swindles others by means of a gold brick.
meanings.sent1: The goldbricked promised the investors huge returns on their 'gold' bricks.
meanings.sent2: The cunning goldbricked convinced many to invest in his 'rare' gold bricks.
meanings.sent3: The town's notorious goldbricked was finally caught after years of cheating people.
meanings.sent4: The smooth-talking goldbricked managed to sell fake gold bricks to the entire neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the charming goldbricked who claims to have a special deal on gold bricks.
